item.title: India set to host GCCs of over 620 Forbes Global 2000 companies by 2030 - The Economic Times
item.description:
India to Host Over 620 GCCs from Forbes Global 2000 Companies by 2030

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

India is on track to host over 620 global capability centres (GCC) of Forbes Global 2000 companies by the year 2030, with a significant increase in both the number of companies and the talent base.

  • Projected increase of GCCs by nearly 40% by 2030.
  • The talent base at these centres is expected to grow by 45%, reaching 1.9 million employees.
  • Currently, 450 companies operate 825 GCCs across India.
  • 85% of GCCs are focused on artificial intelligence and data analytics.
  • Major operational hubs include Bengaluru and Hyderabad.
‚ÄúBy leveraging these regional collaborations, GCCs can accelerate innovation and lead in emerging technological advancements...‚Äù

This growth highlights India's strategic position as a hub for innovation and technology, attracting significant investment and talent by offering competitive advantages.

item.title: This is a once-in-a-lifetime event you don't want to miss! - 91.1 Hot FM
item.description:
Comet C/2024 G3 ATLAS: A Once-in-a-Lifetime Viewing Opportunity

Publication Date: January 13, 2025

Source: Latest in Space

This week, comet C/2024 G3 (ATLAS), a rare celestial wonder, can be viewed with the naked eye, particularly in the Southern Hemisphere, as it approaches its closest point to the sun.

  • Discovered in April 2024 by ATLAS, this massive ball of ice and dust is now visible around perihelion.
  • For the first time in 160,000 years, the comet is gracing our skies, providing a unique opportunity for skywatchers.
  • Optimal viewing is recommended around January 16 or 17 from Australia.
  • The comet's brightness is expected to increase as it approaches the sun.
‚ÄúOnce in a 160,000 year comet seen from the International Space Station üò≥‚Äù ‚Äî Latest in Space

Viewing tips include watching towards the western horizon at twilight and using binoculars for better detail.

This event promises breathtaking sights and is expected to be a memorable experience for all who witness it.

item.title: Why the race to the Moon will heat up in 2025: 'Good time for lunar economy' - India Today
item.description:
Why the race to the Moon will heat up in 2025: 'Good time for lunar economy'

Published On: Jan 15, 2025

Source: indiatodayglobal

2025 marks a thrilling chapter in lunar exploration as multiple companies embark on missions to uncover lunar secrets and expand the lunar economy following years of development.

  • Firefly, Ispace, and Intuitive Machines are set to launch major missions to the Moon.
  • Firefly's Blue Ghost aims to land near Mons Latreille in Mare Crisium, carrying geological experiments.
  • Ispace's Resilience will explore Mare Frigoris and test algae-based food production.
  • Intuitive Machines will launch the Athena lander targeting the Moon's south pole with ice-mining experiments.
  • NASA is actively involved, pushing towards a sustainable human presence on the Moon.
‚ÄúThis is a good time for the lunar economy.‚Äù - Jason Kim, CEO of Firefly

The race for lunar exploration is set to escalate, promising advancements in science and competition among nations.

item.title: How to see the Wolf moon, Mars opposition, and planetary parade: When and where to watch them - The Economic Times
item.description:
How to see the Wolf moon, Mars opposition, and planetary parade: When and where to watch them

Publication Date: January 12, 2025
Source: NASA

The Wolf Moon reaches peak illumination on January 13, coinciding with the beginning of the Prayag Kumbh Mela festival in India. Additionally, a rare planetary parade peaks on January 25, featuring seven visible planets in the night sky.

Key Points:

  • The Wolf Moon will be full from January 13 to January 15.
  • A planetary alignment will occur on January 25, with seven planets visible.
  • The best viewing times are shortly after sunset, away from city lights.
  • Mars will be at opposition on January 16, appearing brighter than in over two years.
  • The Venus-Saturn conjunction will happen on January 17-18.
‚ÄúThese multi-planet viewing opportunities aren‚Äôt super rare, but they don‚Äôt happen every year, so it‚Äôs worth checking out.‚Äù - Preston Dyches, NASA‚Äôs Jet Propulsion Laboratory

With January‚Äôs celestial events, skywatchers have a unique chance to observe significant astrological phenomena, connecting with the cosmos.

item.title: NASA Sends 10 Science Instruments to Moon on Firefly Lander - Mirage News
item.description:
NASA Sends 10 Science Instruments to Moon on Firefly Lander

Date: January 15, 2025 | Source: NASA

As part of NASA's CLPS (Commercial Lunar Payload Services) initiative and Artemis campaign, the agency is preparing to fly ten instruments aboard Firefly Aerospace's Blue Ghost lander for better understanding of the Moon and advancing technology for future crewed missions.

  • Scheduled launch on SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket from Kennedy Space Center.
  • Instruments designed to answer key questions about lunar navigation and surface interaction.
  • Payloads include advanced technologies for dust mitigation and lunar geology studies.
‚ÄúBy supporting a robust cadence of lunar deliveries, NASA will continue to enable a growing lunar economy while leveraging the entrepreneurial innovation of the commercial space industry.‚Äù

This mission is a significant step forward in lunar exploration, focusing on both scientific research and the development of new technologies for future expeditions.

item.title: ‚ÄòGhost island‚Äô appears and disappears in Caspian Sea ‚Äì You won‚Äôt believe how quickly it vanished | Today News - Mint
item.description:
Ghost Island Appears and Disappears in Caspian Sea

Publication Date: 2023

Source: Live Mint

A transient ‚Äúghost island‚Äù, formed by a mud volcano eruption in the Caspian Sea, briefly captivated researchers as it appeared in early 2023 but vanished by the end of 2024.

  • The island, resulting from the Kumani Bank mud volcano eruption, emerged approximately 15 miles off Azerbaijan's eastern coast.
  • NASA tracked its emergence, with the island measuring about 400 meters across.
  • This phenomenon is not unique; Kumani Bank has produced similar islands over the years, with rapid erosion typical of mud volcano activity.
  • Azerbaijan is known for having the highest concentration of mud volcanoes, with over 300 present in the region.
‚ÄúThe Kumani Bank eruption produced an island with a sizable landmass, but it was short-lived.‚Äù - Mark Tingay, Geologist, University of Adelaide

The sudden appearance and quick disappearance of this island underscore the volatile nature of geological processes in the region.

item.title: Affected by the Los Angeles wildfires, NASA‚Äôs Deep Space Network Mission Control Center is empty for the first time in 60 years - Passionategeekz
item.description:
NASA‚Äôs Deep Space Network Center Left Empty Due to LA Wildfires

Publication Date: January 14, 2023 | Source: Passionategeekz

The Los Angeles wildfires have had devastating effects on Southern California, leading to the evacuation of NASA's Jet Propulsion Laboratory and leaving the Deep Space Network mission control center empty for the first time since its opening.

  • The wildfires have destroyed homes and infrastructure, threatening NASA's facilities.
  • NASA's Deep Space Network has maintained communication with space missions despite the chaos.
  • JPL's mission control office was evacuated to an emergency center amidst the fires.
  • The wildfires have reportedly killed at least 16 people and displaced thousands.
  • NASA has relaxed deadlines for funding applications for affected scientists.
‚ÄúOur incredible Deep Space Network team worked extremely hard to ensure that no data was lost,‚Äù said a NASA representative.

This unprecedented event marks a significant disruption for NASA, yet the organization continues to ensure that its exploration efforts remain uninterrupted amidst the challenges posed by the wildfires.

item.title: Los Angeles fires leave NASA's Deep Space Network mission control empty for 1st time in 60 years - Space.com
item.description:
Los Angeles fires leave NASA's Deep Space Network mission control empty for 1st time in 60 years

Publication Date: January 13, 2023 Source: NASA

The devastating wildfires in Los Angeles have forced NASA to evacuate their Jet Propulsion Laboratory, resulting in the Deep Space Network mission control being empty for the first time since its establishment in 1963.

  • The fires in Southern California have caused extents of devastation, threatening infrastructure.
  • NASA's DSN maintained communication with spacecraft despite the evacuation.
  • NASA officials expressed concern for affected employees, with many losing homes.
  • The fires have resulted in at least 16 deaths and left thousands homeless.
  • Nasa celebrated its DSN's 60th anniversary in 2023.
‚ÄúOur incredible DSN team has gone above and beyond to ensure that not a bit of data has been lost.‚Äù - Nicola Fox, NASA's associate administrator for science missions.

The ongoing support from community members to those displaced by the fires is commendable, and NASA is working on ways to assist their colleagues affected by this crisis.

item.title: Scientists discover 'sunken worlds' hidden deep within Earth's mantle that shouldn't be there - Livescience.com
item.description:
Scientists discover 'sunken worlds' hidden deep within Earth's mantle that shouldn't be there

Publication Date: Nov. 4, 2024 | Source: Live Science

A recent study reveals potential patches of Earth's ancient crust, termed 'sunken worlds', discovered deep within the mantle using advanced seismographic techniques. These anomalies raise questions as they are not located near tectonic activity zones.

  • Researchers used a new seismographic imaging method called full-waveform inversion to uncover numerous potential subducted slabs in the mantle.
  • Some identified anomalies are found in areas with no known tectonic activity, such as beneath the western Pacific Ocean.
  • Leading researcher Thomas Schouten expressed uncertainty about the nature of these blobs, stating they represent a major mystery.
‚ÄúWith the new high-resolution model, we can see such anomalies everywhere in the Earth's mantle. But we don't know exactly what they are.‚Äù - Thomas Schouten

Other theories suggest the blobs may be remnants of Earth's crust from its formation or dense materials accumulated over time. Further research is essential to determine their origins and implications.

item.title: How to See and Photograph Six Planets in the Sky This January - How-To Geek
item.description:
How to See and Photograph Six Planets in the Sky This January

Publication Date: January 2025 Source: How-To Geek

This January, a rare celestial event allows stargazers to observe up to six planets in the evening sky. Although you won‚Äôt see all seven planets aligned simultaneously, Venus, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, and Neptune will be visible with varying requirements.

  • Many people believe they can see all seven planets aligned on January 25, but that‚Äôs a myth; only six will be visible.
  • With the naked eye, Venus, Mars, Jupiter, and Saturn can be observed without any equipment, while Uranus and Neptune may require optical aids.
  • Best viewing times include the middle of January, especially January 17-18 for Venus and Saturn.
  • Factors such as light pollution and cloud cover significantly impact visibility, so finding dark, clear skies is essential.
  • Photography tips include using a tripod, adjusting ISO settings, and utilizing specialized apps to capture the planets.
‚ÄúWith some patience and practice, you can capture the beauty of our planetary neighbors with just your smartphone.‚Äù

In conclusion, January presents an excellent opportunity for amateur astronomers to experience and photograph these planetary alignments by preparing effectively and utilizing available resources.

item.title: XMM-Newton Observes Puzzling X-ray Oscillations from Black Hole - SpaceWatch.Global
item.description:
XMM-Newton Observes Puzzling X-ray Oscillations from Black Hole

Publication Date: Not specified Source: ESA

ESA's XMM-Newton has detected rapidly fluctuating X-rays coming from the edge of a supermassive black hole in a nearby galaxy, challenging current theories on matter absorption by black holes and suggesting a potential source of gravitational waves.

  • Rapid X-ray fluctuations detected from a supermassive black hole.
  • Findings contradict existing theories on how matter falls into black holes.
  • Potential implications for future gravitational wave detection by LISA.
‚ÄúThe results defy how experts believe matter falls into such black holes.‚Äù

This observation by ESA could reshape understanding of black hole behavior and contribute to future gravitational wave research.

item.title: First full Moon of 2025: Will Wolf Moon be visible from India; know details - Business Standard
item.description:
First Full Moon of 2025: Wolf Moon and Lunar Occultation Details

Date: Today

Source: Unspecified

The first full moon of 2025, known as the Wolf Moon, features a rare occurrence where it will pass in front of Mars, leading to a lunar occultation.

Key Points:

  • The lunar occultation occurs as the moon obscures Mars, which is approximately 40,000 times brighter.
  • The full moon peaks at 3:57 AM IST.
  • The Wolf Moon is named for the active howling of wolves in January.
  • This celestial event can be viewed using telescopes or binoculars, as Mars will not be visible from India.
No, the first full moon of January 2025 wouldn't be visible from India.

Only locations in the contiguous United States and parts of Canada will witness this spectacular event.

item.title: 6 Very Beautiful Pictures Of Nebulas Taken By NASA Hubble Space Telescope - Times Now
item.description:
6 Very Beautiful Pictures Of Nebulas Taken By NASA Hubble Space Telescope

Publication Date: Jan 14, 2025 | Source: Times Now Digital

This article showcases six breathtaking images of Nebulas captured by NASA's Hubble Space Telescope, revealing the stunning beauty and complexity of these cosmic structures.

  • The Eagle Nebula features a towering column of gas and dust stretching 9.5 light-years high.
  • The Bubble Nebula, located 8,000 light-years from Earth, showcases vibrant colours and unique structure.
  • The Carina Nebula contains the intricate Keyhole Nebula, revealing previously hidden details through advanced imaging techniques.
  • The Ghost Nebula (IC 63) reflects nearby starlight and emits hydrogen-alpha radiation.
  • The Dumbbell Nebula, or Messier 76, is a photogenic subject located 3,400 light-years away.
  • The Lagoon Nebula is a stellar nursery, showcasing chaotic cosmic activity over an impressive 55 light-years in width.
‚ÄúPrepare to be mesmerized by 6 breathtaking images of nebulas captured by the NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope.‚Äù

In conclusion, these images not only highlight the beauty of the universe but also inspire further exploration and study of celestial phenomena.

item.title: Engineering quantum entanglement at the nanoscale - Nanowerk
item.description:
Engineering Quantum Entanglement at the Nanoscale

Date Published: Jan 14, 2025 Source: Nanowerk News

Researchers have developed a drastically smaller and more energy-efficient method of creating coveted photon pairs that influence each other from any distance. The technology could transform computing, telecommunications, and sensing.

  • The new method creates photon pairs using a smaller device with less energy compared to traditional methods that require large crystals.
  • The research team achieved successes in nonlinear optics to change light properties for various applications.
  • This advancement points toward integrating essential quantum components onto silicon chips.
  • Specific use of van der Waals materials proves useful in generating photon pairs at telecommunications wavelengths efficiently.
  • Research may have immediate applications in satellite communication and mobile quantum communication.
‚ÄúThis work represents the embodiment of the long-sought goal of bridging macroscopic and microscopic nonlinear and quantum optics,‚Äù - P. James Schuck

The findings represent a significant step towards practical applications in quantum technology, suggesting a future dominated by smaller and more efficient devices.

item.description:
Unexpected Tectonic Plate Remnants Discovered Beneath Earth's Surface

Publication Date: Unknown

Source: News Karnataka

A significant discovery has been made deep beneath the Earth's surface, providing new insights into tectonic plate movements.

  • Researchers found remnants of tectonic plates that were previously theorized to be lost.
  • This discovery may change our understanding of geological processes over millions of years.
  • The team plans to conduct further studies to analyze the implications of their findings.
‚ÄúThis could be a game-changer in how we perceive Earth's geological history,‚Äù said a leading researcher.

In conclusion, the discovery of these tectonic remnants could reshape geological theories and provide valuable information for future studies.

item.title: NASA's Roman Space Telescope set to challenge James Webb Space Telescope in 2027; here's how - The Times of India
item.description:
NASA's Roman Space Telescope Set to Challenge James Webb Space Telescope in 2027

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

The NASA Roman Space Telescope, scheduled for launch in 2027, aims to outperform the James Webb Space Telescope by expanding our understanding of dark energy and exoplanets. Equipped with groundbreaking technology, it will allow scientists to study distant galaxies and the mysteries of the universe's expansion.

  • The telescope will undergo simulated launch conditions testing in May 2027 to ensure its robustness for real-world conditions.
  • Integration of all components is crucial for operational testing and stability ahead of the launch.
  • Rigorous environmental tests will ensure the telescope's functionality in extreme conditions of space.
  • The telescope will provide broad cosmic perspectives on galaxy and star formation, as well as studying exoplanet atmospheres.
  • One of its goals is to uncover the mysteries surrounding dark energy and its role in the universe's expansion.
  • NASA aims to ensure optical precision for high-resolution imaging of far-off celestial objects.
‚ÄúThis mission has become one step closer to transforming the dream that the human race had for so long - to make earth-shattering discoveries about the universe.‚Äù - Mark Clampin, NASA official

The Roman Space Telescope represents a significant leap forward in space exploration, and its successful launch in 2027 could redefine our understanding of the cosmos.

item.title: Inside the ISS: NASA Crew‚Äôs Thrilling Week of Spacewalks and Scientific Breakthroughs - SciTechDaily
item.description:
Inside the ISS: NASA Crew‚Äôs Thrilling Week of Spacewalks and Scientific Breakthroughs

Publication Date: Unspecified
Source: SciTech Daily

NASA astronauts are preparing for the first spacewalk of the year aboard the International Space Station (ISS). The Expedition 72 crew is conducting research in various scientific fields while simultaneously preparing for critical maintenance operations in space.

  • Flight Engineer Nick Hague and Commander Suni Williams are set to perform a six-and-a-half-hour spacewalk to work on instruments such as the NICER X-ray telescope.
  • They are also focusing on improving spacecraft safety by studying combustion and flame spread in microgravity.
  • Research on plant growth under different water levels is underway to aid food supply for long-term missions.
  • Emergency preparedness activities include inspecting safety gear and conducting evacuation training.
  • The crew is also engaged in human physiology studies to understand blood flow in microgravity.
‚ÄúUnderstanding how flames spread in space may improve fire safety on crew missions.‚Äù

The ISS serves as a critical platform for advancing our scientific knowledge and capabilities, marking significant steps toward future long-term space missions.

item.title: In Photos: Mars Devoured By ‚ÄòWolf Moon‚Äô In Stunning Sight For U.S. Sky-Watchers - Forbes
item.description:
Mars Devoured By ‚ÄòWolf Moon‚Äô In Spectacular Sky Event

Date: January 13, 2025   Source: Forbes

The first full moon of 2025, known as the 'Wolf Moon,' was witnessed by sky-watchers in North America as it briefly blocked Mars during a lunar occultation.

  • The occultation lasted for about an hour, obscuring Mars from view.
  • This rare celestial event coincided with Mars being the closest to Earth since December 2022.
  • Mars reached opposition on January 15, making it fully illuminated.
  • The phenomenon was a visual illusion caused by the moon crossing the ecliptic plane.
  • Observers noted the relative distances: Mars was 59.7 million miles away while the moon was 224,000 miles distant.
Mars appeared fully illuminated and brighter than at any other time since December 2022, despite being outshone by Venus.

The 'Wolf Moon' is traditionally associated with January and has several alternative names, including the Stay Home Moon and Snow Moon, with the next full moon set for February 12, 2025.
